results.title: Dirt [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Michael Covert, Trace Fraim, Kirk Hassig, Trudi Callon and Canned Pictures
results.brief_description: Two daft Texan brothers, Scooter and Junior, are left bereft and domestically helpless when their dear old Ma dies. They hatch a plan to get a woman to replace her, searching strip bars, and even approaching a prostitute to fulfil the role. When these attempts fail they kidnap DeDe (Tara Chocol), who, due to the sadistic nature of her marriage, decides to stay with them. After DeDe’s husband, a Texas Ranger, burns their house down, the brothers rob banks to support the burgeoning family. Junior, who has emotional problems, falls for DeDe whilst Scooter forms an attraction to a bank teller, Margaret, at a local branch they frequent. “Dirt” is a black comedy and farce that apes the style and energy of a Coen brothers’ film (in particular Raising Arizona) but screenwriter, director and star Michael Covert fails to achieve the same distinctly outlandish tone. Despite some slyly inspired moments, and witty one-liners, Covert ultimately opts for conventional narrative outcomes over his subversive intentions. The film trots out a slew of familiar Texan movie cliches (bigoted and corrupt police, violent husbands, dim-witted simple folk) whilst amid all the darkly themed humour, it attempts to make some salient points about the futility of male violence. Also stars Tracy Fraim, Patrick Warburton and Olivia Rosewood.

results.title: Dinosaurs: the terrible lizards
results.creator_credit: Wah Chang and Charles Cahill and Associates
results.brief_description: Uses special effects and models to recreate the age of the dinosaurs. Gives an overview of what they looked like, what they ate, and how they lived and died. Suitable for lower and upper primary levels.

results.title: Dinosaurs: fun, facts and fantasy
results.creator_credit: Clive Doig, Malcolm Craddock and Picture Palace Productions
results.brief_description: This informative and entertaining program is a mixture of puppets, songs, animated models, drawings, old film footage and dramatised sequences, and it will answer everything you ever wanted to know about dinosaurs.

results.title: Dinosaur
results.creator_credit: Eric Leighton, Ralph Zondag, Pam Marsden and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Computer animated feature from Walt Disney Pictures, artfully combined live action backgrounds with CGI pre-historic beasts. This family oriented adventure movie is about an orphaned dinosaur raised by lemurs. Years later when the inhabitants flee the continent, Aladar, as he is known, encounters his own kind for the first time. The landmark animation of this feature was highly praised for its attention to detail and awe-inspiring aesthetics. Features the voices of D.B. Sweeney, Alfre Woodard, Ossie Davis, Max Casella, Hayden Panettiere, and Sam Wright.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Leighton, Ralph Zondag, Pam Marsden and Walt Disney Pictures

results.title: Dinosaur
results.creator_credit: Eric Leighton, Ralph Zondag, Pam Marsden and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Lavish Disney family movie, “Dinosaur” broke new ground with its awe-inspiring aesthetics of computer animation, set against live action backgrounds. The simplistic story is pure Disney - Aladar is an iguanodon snatched by a pterodactyl whilst still in the egg; the egg, via a range of predators and mishaps, makes a treacherous journey across land and sea until a clan of lemurs adopt the baby as one of their own; when a meteor shower rattles the inhabitants of the continent, they decide to flee; en route, Aladar experiences life with his own kind for the first time. The film entertains a gentle, traditional family brand of humour that supports the themes of compassion, friendship and tolerance with a gentle nod toward respecting one’s elders. The predictable narrative progression, a conventional quest that supports a basic morality of good triumphing over evil, is overcome by the impressive animation and stupendous set pieces.

results.title: Paws
results.creator_credit: Karl Zwicky, Andrena Finlay, Vicki Watson, AFFC, Latent Image Productions, New South Wales Film and Television Office and PolyGram Film International
results.brief_description: Zac (Nathan Cavaleri) never wanted a dog, until he met a special dog called PC. PC’s master, Alex, is murdered by the evil associates of his ex wife, Anja. Anja and Alex used to live in Iceland where Alex wrote computer programs; the only problem was that Anja stole her husband’s programs and sold them. Alex managed to escape to Australia with 1 million dollars and PC. Before his death Alex attaches a computer disc to PC’s collar and sends him off to a friend. PC ends up in the care of her neighbour, Zac. Through the assistance of a computer which translates dog noises into a human voice, Zac and PC become quickly become friends as they try and avoid Anja and find the 1 million dollars before her. Also starring Norman Kaye, Sandy Gore, Caroline Gillmer, Emilie Francois and Billy Connolly as the voice of PC.

results.title: Pavarotti in London
results.brief_description: The magnificent Luciano Pavarotti performing at his best in a Gala Concert performance at the Royal Albert Hall on 13th April 1982 in the presence of Her Majesty, Queen Elizabeth, the Queen Mother, and featuring the Royal Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by Kurt Herbert Adler. Recorded live on location.

Recorded live on location.

results.title: Peace and quiet [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Dave Redman, Daniel Armstrong and Strong Man Pictures
results.brief_description: When the formula to create a super secret agent is stolen from Dr. Genius, it’s left up to special agents Julian Pearce and Frank Quiet to get it back. (Awards: Winner of the Best Special Effects, St Kilda film Festival, 2000, Best Editing in an Australian Film) Cast includes Charles Hollywood and Brian Sisko. Written by Daniel Armstrong.

results.title: Peace Corps in the Majya
results.brief_description: Depicts the work of four Peace Corps volunteers in the Majya Valley of the Niger River. The two young men are an agricultural co-op specialist and a teacher. The young women are public health workers teaching Nigerian mothers to prevent infant mortality. Narrated by George Peppard.

results.title: Paying for the past [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Nicola Woolmington, Penny Robins, Annamax Media, Film Victoria and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: An intriguing documentary which follows the story of a group of lawyers from Germany, United States and Australia who are in the process of negotiating the biggest class action the world has ever seen. Acting on behalf of Holocaust survivors who were either used as forced labour or slave labour for the German industrialists such as Siemens, BMW and Krupp, during World War II, these lawyers are seeking to put closure on Germany’s dark past through financial compensation, and emotional and moral reparation. Forced and slave labourers worked under the most horrendous conditions and came from the concentration camps, consisting of gypsies, homosexuals and Jews. BMW had upto 20,000 slave labourers by 1944, many who did not survive. Whereas forced labourers were never intended to be killed off, slave labourers were part of a German “destruction through work” policy, for example, at Krupp’s, eight out of ten slave labourers died. Australia, with the highest Holocaust survivor population after Israel, has over 3000 claimants with Henry Burstyner, a tenacious and unrelenting Melbourne lawyer, representing Australia in the class action. Includes personal narratives from Kitia Altman, Abraham Biderman and Erica Turek, Holocaust survivors in Melbourne and Sydney, along with family photographs, stills and archival footage and appearances by Karen Heilig (Claims Conference, NY), Kenneth McCallion (Goodkind Firm), Dr Michael Witti (Germany), Ed Fagan (Fagan & D’Avino, US) and Henry Burstyner in their negotiations with the German companies - their aim: settlement by the end of the millenium. Narrated by Robert Menzies.
